text: Loddon Nature Reserve is a nature reserve on the edge of the village of Twyford in Berkshire. It is managed by the Berkshire, Buckinghamshire and Oxfordshire Wildlife Trust. ==Geography and site== Loddon Nature Reserve is located on the site of a former gravel pit which is now flooded and has woody surrounds. The flooded gravel pit has several islands. ==Fauna== The site has the following fauna: ===Birds=== ==Flora== The site has the following flora: ===Plants=== *Lythrum salicaria *Iris pseudacorus ==References== Category:Parks and open spaces in Berkshire Category:Nature reserves in Berkshire Category:West Berkshire District Category:Berkshire, Buckinghamshire and Oxfordshire Wildlife Trust
title: Loddon Nature Reserve
